answer.explanation:
M: Joanne, did you hear that all employees will be receiving free tablet computers next week? Q1 I’m excited about it, but actually I don’t know how to use one. Even my mobile phone is not a smartphone.
W: Don’t worry about it. I have one at home and they are very user-friendly. You won’t have any trouble familiarizing yourself with it.
M: I’m glad to hear that. Q2 As a logo design company, we can definitely use the tablet computers to increase work efficiency.
W: You’re right. Q3 If you have any questions, feel free to ask me for help.

question.text: What is the man concerned about?
choices: (B) Paying for his new mobile phone

question.text: Where do the speakers work?
What does the woman offer to do?

answer.explanation:
M: Excuse me. Q1 I’m conducting research on the effect that the new downtown mall is having on local residents’ shopping habits. Do you have a moment to talk to me?
W: Sure, no problem. I can tell you that since the mall was built, I find myself coming downtown a lot more. Q2 I think what I like most is that I never have to struggle to find a parking spot.
M: I see. What about the variety of shops? Are you satisfied with that?
W: Q3 Well, I usually come to the mall to shop for clothes. I think there is a wide selection of women’s clothes.

question.text: Who most likely is the man?
What does the woman mention about the mall?
choices: (D) It is located outside of town.

question.text: Why does the woman usually visit the mall?

answer.explanation:
W: Q1 Have you placed the order yet? Mr. Johnson just called and said he wants two more laptops, and a 50-inch monitor.
M: Well, I already placed the previous order, Q2 but the laptops and monitor will have to wait until tomorrow. The supply company closes at 8:00 P.M.
W: Oh, will they be able to deliver to US on the same day? Mr. Johnson was hoping to get everything tomorrow.
M: I’m not sure. I'll call them first thing in the morning and find out.
W: Meanwhile, how much was the total for the order?
M: It came to $12,500. Do we have enough in our budget for more laptops and a monitor?
W: Q3 I’ll call Mr. Johnson and ask. It looks like we’ve gone over our budget.

question.text: What are the speakers discussing?
Why does the man mention when the supply company closes?
choices: (A) To inform her of the business hours
(B) To let her know she can’t order anything
(C) To explain that the second order would be late
(D) To imply that new equipment can’t be ordered

answer.text: (C) To explain that the second order would be late

question.text: What does the woman offer to do?

answer.explanation:
W: Hi, Mr. Jeffries. Q1 Unfortunately, our client in New Jersey called and said they have to reschedule the meeting date to 5th of July. I went ahead and booked a ticket for the 4th. Is it OK if you go straight to Washington after New Jersey?
M: What about the client in Washington? Were they comfortable with the schedule?
W: Yes. Q2 I explained that we need to postpone the meeting in Washington because of our client in New Jersey. I think this gives us time to prepare some additional materials for your presentation. I would like to add some more details to your PowerPoint slides about our new products. Let’s meet this afternoon and discuss it.
M: Q3 That’s not a bad idea. I’ll see you this afternoon.

question.text: What is the problem?
choices: (A) The plane tickets were not booked.
(B) A meeting had to be rescheduled.

answer.text: (B) A meeting had to be rescheduled.

question.text: Which part of the business trip will be postponed?
What does the man mean when he says “That’s not a bad idea”?
choices: (C) Not having time for her children

answer.explanation:
M: Q1 Rachel, how was your vacation in Australia?
W: It was fantastic. It is a beautiful country, but we did not get to see everything we wanted to see. Maybe we will go back in the future. Have you managed to find a new account manager yet? We are starting to get busy and we need some more staff.
M: Actually, there is someone we are looking to hire. His cv is quite impressive. Here, take a look.
W: Q2 What’s this? Is this Robert Wilder’s application? I have known him for years! Q3 We play tennis together on the weekends. So you are thinking about hiring him?
M: Yeah. The interview went really well and he has all the qualifications. I think he can be a great member of our team.
W: I agree. I have never worked with him, but personally, I think he will be an excellent employee. I’m just surprised to see him applying here.

question.text: What was the woman doing in Australia?
What does the woman imply when she says “Is this Robert Wilder’s application?”
choices: (A) She is surprised to see the application.

answer.text: (A) She is surprised to see the application.

question.text: How does the woman know Robert Wilder?
choices: (B) They work in the same department.

answer.explanation:
M1: Tom and Julie, I need the sales reports for this month ready a bit early. Next month is really important for our company so we need to prepare a bit earlier than usual.
W: Sure. But we will need to do some overtime. Q1 We are really busy at the moment so it’s going to be a lot of extra hours after work, and I have to take care of my children.
M2: Yeah, that’s a lot of extra work. Q2 I think after next month we should get a few days added to our vacation.
W: That sounds reasonable. Q3 I will need to hire a babysitter while I’m doing the overtime, so the extra vacation time seems fair.
M1: I agree. Okay, we will discuss the details later, but I definitely agree with you.

question.text: What is the woman concerned about?
choices: (C) Not having time for her children

answer.text: (C) Not having time for her children

question.text: What does the man suggest?
What does the woman say she will have to do?

answer.explanation:
W: Hi, we are renovating our boardroom and I’d like to purchase some cherry wood tables for our conference room. Q1 I am having a meeting with some very important clients on Friday. So I’d like to have them delivered tomorrow. What is the cost for an emergency delivery?
M: Hold a moment please... Next day delivery is an extra seventy-five dollars.
W: Really? That is expensive. I thought if my order was over three hundred dollars, delivery would be free of charge.
M: Well, yes. Q2 Are you planning to order the cherry wood tables?
W: Q2 Yes, I would like two of them.
M: OK then, Q3 I will make sure that your order arrives tomorrow morning before midday, and delivery will be free of charge.

question.text: What does the woman have on Friday?
Look at the graphic. How much does the woman pay for the furniture?
What does the man say he will do?
choices: (B) Deliver the furniture in the evening

answer.explanation:
W: Hi, this is Rachel. Q1 I’m calling to see if I can upgrade from coach to business for my flight to Q2 Thailand this June.
M: OK, can I have your membership number please?
W: Yes, it’s EM3985771.
M: Q3 I’m sorry. You don’t have enough points for this trip. However, I see that you’re traveling to Korea and Japan next week. That should give you enough points to upgrade in June. Why don’t you call again after your trip?
W: OK, that’s a great idea. I’ll call again in two weeks.

question.text: Why does the woman call?
choices: (B) To book a flight to Korea and Japan
(C) To cancel her flight to Singapore
(D) To sign up for a mileage card

question.text: Look at the graphic. How many points will the woman use?
What suggestion does the man give the woman?
choices: (B) Make the request after her trip

answer.text: (B) Make the request after her trip

answer.explanation:
W: Q1 You beat me again! You always get to work before I do even though I leave before you. How do you do that?
M: Which road do you take?
W: Q2 I just follow my GPS and it shows that Kingsley Road is the most direct route to work.
M: No, don’t follow your GPS. Your route passes through several residential areas and school zones as well as traffic signs, so it takes much longer to get here.
W: Which route do you take then?
M: Q3 I go to Cambridge street, which takes a bit of a detour from our apartments, but it’s practically a highway. I even have enough time to stop for some coffee before work.
W: Wow, I always thought Cambridge would take much longer.
M: No, it’s really quick. I can show you next time.

question.text: What are the speakers discussing?
choices: (C) How far Cambridge is from their apartments

question.text: What does the woman want to do?
choices: (B) Make more money than he does
(C) Get to work faster than he does

answer.text: (C) Get to work faster than he does

question.text: Look at the list. Which shop does the man most likely stop at?

answer.explanation:
M-Cn: Excuse me, Q1 I saw the ad for you department store on the Internet, so I decided to stop by. You’re having a big sale today, right?. Does that apply to jewelry items, too?
W-Br” Absolutely. Q2 Everything in the display cases is up to half-off the full price. Did you bring the coupon that came with the advertisement?
M-Cn: Actually, Q3 I printed it out but then forgot it at my office. I will come back after work to take a better look. May be I can get all my gift shopping done for the entire year!

question.text: Why did the man choose to shop at the store?
choices: (B) The store is close to his office.

question.text: What does the woman ask for?
Why does the man say he will return at a later time?
choices: (A) He is late for a meeting.
(B) He wants to go to another store.
(C) He has to make a phone call.
(D) He left something at the office.

answer.text: (D) He left something at the office.
